Characteristic.name: Record Access Control Point

InformativeText.Summary: This control point is used with a service to provide basic management functionality for the Glucose Sensor patient record database. This enables functions including counting records, transmitting records and clearing records based on filter criterion. The filter criterion in the Operand field is defined by the service that references this characteristic as is the format of a record (which may be comprised of one or more characteristics) and the sequence of transferred records.

Enumeration.value: Report stored records (Operator: Value from Operator Table)
Delete stored records (Operator: Value from Operator Table)
Abort operation (Operator: Null 'value of 0x00 from Operator Table')
Report number of stored records (Operator: Value from Operator Table)
Number of stored records response (Operator: Null 'value of 0x00 from Operator Table')
Response Code (Operator: Null 'value of 0x00 from Operator Table')

Field.name: Operand
Field.InformativeText: The operands correspond to the Op Code values (Keys 0 to 255) defined in the Op Code Field above

Enumeration.value: Filter parameters (as appropriate to Operator and Service)
Filter parameters (as appropriate to Operator and Service)
Filter parameters (as appropriate to Operator and Service)
Number of Records (Field size defined per service)
Request Op Code, Response Code Value

Enumeration.description: Normal response if unsupported Op Code is received
Normal response if Operator received does not meet the requirements of the service (e.g. Null was expected)
Normal response if unsupported Operator is received
Normal response if Operand received does not meet the requirements of the service
Normal response if request to report stored records or request to delete stored records resulted in no records meeting criteria.
Normal response if request for Abort cannot be completed
Normal response if unable to complete a procedure for any reason
Normal response if unsupported Operand is received

Characteristic.Note: The fields in the above table are in the order of LSO to MSO. Where LSO = Least Significant Octet and MSO = Most Significant Octet.
